alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 9:01PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Scotts Bluff and southwestern Sioux Counties through 830 PM MDT... At 801 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Morrill, or 13 miles southeast of Torrington, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mitchell, Morrill, Lyman, Stegall, Hubbard Hill and Henry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
